column3: and a pinch of bone dust~duration=Instantaneous~description=This spell creates an Undead servant. Choose a pile of bones or a corpse of a Medium or Small humanoid within range. Your spell imbues the target with a foul mimicry of life
column4: raising it as an Undead creature. The target becomes a Skeleton if you chose bones or a Zombie if you chose a corpse (the DM has the creature's game statistics).$On each of your turns
column5: you can use a Bonus Action to mentally Command any creature you made with this spell if the creature is within 60 feet of you (if you control multiple creatures
column6: you can Command any or all of them at the same time
column7: issuing the same Command to each one). You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn
column8: or you can issue a general Command
column9: such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands
column10: the creature only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order
column11: the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete.$The creature is under your control for 24 hours
column12: after which it stops obeying any Command you've given it. To maintain the control of the creature for another 24 hours
column13: you must cast this spell on the creature again before the current 24-hour period ends. This use of the spell reasserts your control over up to four creatures you have animated with this spell
column14: rather than animating a new one.~at_higher_levels=When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher
column15: you animate or reassert control over two additional Undead creatures for each slot above 3rd. Each of the creatures must come from a different corpse or pile of bones.
